oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Soldier looking out from Huey in flight

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A Huey in flight taken from another helicopter. A soldier and the barrel of an M-16 are also in the frame. The helicopters appear to be flying over a farming area. The photograph is from Ammons's first tour in 1968.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Helicopters; Rifles; Soldiers; Helmets; Military uniforms; Military personnel; Rural areas
Ammons, Christopher D., 1948- ; United States. Army. Infantry Division, 1st; Vietnam War, 1961-1975 -- Aerial operations, American; Military helicopters -- United States -- History; UH-1 (Helicopter)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The UH-1 (or as it was originally designated the HU-1) "Huey" is one of the most recognizable and widely used helicopters in the world. During the Vietnam conflict, Hueys were used for many purposes including MedEvac, command and control, air assault, personnel and matriel transport, etc. It has several distinctive characteristics such as a rounded nose, a twin-bladed rotor, and the loud "whomp-whomp" sound the helicopter makes in flight. Approximately 7,000 UH-1 aircraft saw service in Vietnam.
